definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: The Way of the Dragon God believes that the heart, more than anything else, points the way forward.
sentences.chinese: 龍神道相信指引方向的最大力量莫過於心。

sentences.english: The Stone Arch marks the beginning of the Sacred Way to the Tombs.
sentences.chinese: 那個石拱門標誌着通往陵墓的神道的開始。

sentences.english: Many trees line the Sacred Way as well, including some pine trees that were first planted during the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 神道兩側樹木林立，其中還有一些明朝時種的松樹。
這八百多米長的神道上。

sentences.english: She enveloped the feeble and unconscious creature with love and worship.
sentences.chinese: 她癡愛那微弱無知的小東西，當他神道似的崇拜他。

definition: god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general
Shengzu, temple name of the second Qing emperor, known as the Kangxi Emperor (1654-1722)/cf. 康熙[Kang1 xi1]
to shed skin/to leave one's mortal envelope/remains (of a priest)
time immemorial/origin of the universe/the world
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
